RGFW
A multi-platform single-header very simple-to-use framework library for creating GUI Libraries or simple GUI programs.
Loading...
Searching...
No Matches
RGFW.h
Go to the documentation of this file.

28/*
29 (MAKE SURE RGFW_IMPLEMENTATION is in exactly one header or you use -D RGFW_IMPLEMENTATION)
30 #define RGFW_IMPLEMENTATION - makes it so source code is included with header
31*/
32
33/*
34 #define RGFW_IMPLEMENTATION - (required) makes it so the source code is included
35 #define RGFW_DEBUG - (optional) makes it so RGFW prints debug messages and errors when they're found
36 #define RGFW_EGL - (optional) compile with OpenGL functions, allowing you to use to use EGL instead of the native OpenGL functions
37 #define RGFW_DIRECTX - (optional) include integration directX functions (windows only)
38 #define RGFW_VULKAN - (optional) include helpful vulkan integration functions and macros
39 #define RGFW_WEBGPU - (optional) use WebGPU for rendering
40 #define RGFW_NATIVE - (optional) define native RGFW types that use native API structures
41
42 #define RGFW_X11 (optional) (unix only) if X11 should be used. This option is turned on by default by unix systems except for MacOS
43 #define RGFW_WAYLAND (optional) (unix only) use Wayland. (This can be used with X11)
44 #define RGFW_NO_X11 (optional) (unix only) don't fallback to X11 when using Wayland
45 #define RGFW_NO_LOAD_WGL (optional) (windows only) if WGL should be loaded dynamically during runtime
46 #define RGFW_NO_X11_CURSOR (optional) (unix only) don't use XCursor
47 #define RGFW_NO_X11_CURSOR_PRELOAD (optional) (unix only) use XCursor, but don't link it in code, (you'll have to link it with -lXcursor)
48 #define RGFW_NO_X11_EXT_PRELOAD (optional) (unix only) use Xext, but don't link it in code, (you'll have to link it with -lXext)
49 #define RGFW_NO_LOAD_WINMM (optional) (windows only) use winmm (timeBeginPeriod), but don't link it in code, (you'll have to link it with -lwinmm)
50 #define RGFW_NO_WINMM (optional) (windows only) don't use winmm
51 #define RGFW_NO_IOKIT (optional) (macOS) don't use IOKit
52 #define RGFW_NO_UNIX_CLOCK (optional) (unix) don't link unix clock functions
53 #define RGFW_NO_DWM (windows only) - do not use or link dwmapi
54 #define RGFW_USE_XDL (optional) (X11) if XDL (XLib Dynamic Loader) should be used to load X11 dynamically during runtime (must include XDL.h along with RGFW)
55 #define RGFW_COCOA_GRAPHICS_SWITCHING - (optional) (cocoa) use automatic graphics switching (allow the system to choose to use GPU or iGPU)
56 #define RGFW_COCOA_FRAME_NAME (optional) (cocoa) set frame name
57 #define RGFW_NO_DPI - do not calculate DPI (no XRM nor libShcore included)
58 #define RGFW_ADVANCED_SMOOTH_RESIZE - use advanced methods for smooth resizing (may result in a spike in memory usage or worse performance) (eg. WM_TIMER and XSyncValue)
59 #define RGFW_NO_INFO - do not define the RGFW_info struct (without RGFW_IMPLEMENTATION)
60
61 #define RGFW_ALLOC x - choose the default allocation function (defaults to standard malloc)
62 #define RGFW_FREE x - choose the default deallocation function (defaults to standard free)
63 #define RGFW_USERPTR x - choose the default userptr sent to the malloc call, (NULL by default)
64
65 #define RGFW_EXPORT - use when building RGFW
66 #define RGFW_IMPORT - use when linking with RGFW (not as a single-header)
67
68 #define RGFW_USE_INT - force the use c-types rather than stdint.h (for systems that might not have stdint.h (msvc))
69 #define RGFW_bool x - choose what type to use for bool, by default u32 is used
70*/
71
72/*
73Example to get you started :
74
75linux : gcc main.c -lX11 -lXrandr -lGL
76windows : gcc main.c -lopengl32 -lgdi32
77macos : gcc main.c -framework Cocoa -framework CoreVideo -framework OpenGL -framework IOKit
78
79#define RGFW_IMPLEMENTATION
80#include "RGFW.h"
81
82u8 icon[4 * 3 * 3] = {0xFF, 0x00, 0x00, 0xFF, 0xFF, 0x00, 0x00, 0xFF, 0xFF, 0x00, 0x00, 0xFF, 0xFF, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0xFF, 0xFF, 0x00, 0xFF, 0xFF, 0xFF, 0x00, 0xFF, 0xFF, 0x00, 0x00, 0xFF, 0xFF, 0x00, 0x00, 0xFF, 0xFF, 0x00, 0x00, 0xFF};
83
84int main() {
85 RGFW_window* win = RGFW_createWindow("name", 100, 100, 500, 500, (u64)0);
86 RGFW_event event;
87
88 RGFW_window_setIcon(win, icon, 3, 3, RGFW_formatRGBA);
89
90 while (RGFW_window_shouldClose(win) == RGFW_FALSE) {
91 while (RGFW_window_checkEvent(win, &event)) {
92 if (event.type == RGFW_quit || RGFW_window_window_isKeyPressed(RGFW_escape))
93 break;
94 }
95 }
96
97 RGFW_window_close(win);
98}
99
100 compiling :
101
102 if you wish to compile the library all you have to do is create a new file with this in it
103
104 rgfw.c
105 #define RGFW_IMPLEMENTATION
106 #include "RGFW.h"
107
108 You may also want to add
109 `#define RGFW_EXPORT` when compiling and
110 `#define RGFW_IMPORT`when linking RGFW on it's own:
111 this reduces inline functions and prevents bloat in the object file
112
113 then you can use gcc (or whatever compile you wish to use) to compile the library into object file
114
115 ex. gcc -c RGFW.c -fPIC
116
117 after you compile the library into an object file, you can also turn the object file into an static or shared library
118
119 (commands ar and gcc can be replaced with whatever equivalent your system uses)
120
121 static : ar rcs RGFW.a RGFW.o
122 shared :
123 windows:
124 gcc -shared RGFW.o -lopengl32 -lgdi32 -o RGFW.dll
125 linux:
126 gcc -shared RGFW.o -lX11 -lGL -lXrandr -o RGFW.so
127 macos:
128 gcc -shared RGFW.o -framework CoreVideo -framework Cocoa -framework OpenGL -framework IOKit
129*/
130
131
132
133/*
134 Credits :
135 EimaMei/Sacode : Code review, helped with X11, MacOS and Windows support, Silicon, siliapp.h -> referencing
136
137 stb : This project is heavily inspired by the stb single header files
138
139 SDL, GLFW and other online resources : reference implementations
140
141 contributors : (feel free to put yourself here if you contribute)
142 krisvers (@krisvers) -> code review
143 EimaMei (@SaCode) -> code review
144 Nycticebus (@Code-Nycticebus) -> bug fixes
145 Rob Rohan (@robrohan) -> X11 bugs and missing features, MacOS/Cocoa fixing memory issues/bugs
146 AICDG (@THISISAGOODNAME) -> vulkan support (example)
147 @Easymode -> support, testing/debugging, bug fixes and reviews
148 Joshua Rowe (omnisci3nce) - bug fix, review (macOS)
149 @lesleyrs -> bug fix, review (OpenGL)
150 Nick Porcino (@meshula) - testing, organization, review (MacOS, examples)
151 @therealmarrakesh -> documentation
152 @DarekParodia -> code review (X11) (C++)
153 @NishiOwO -> fix BSD support, fix OSMesa example
154 @BaynariKattu -> code review and documentation
155 Miguel Pinto (@konopimi) -> code review, fix vulkan example
156 @m-doescode -> code review (wayland)
157 Robert Gonzalez (@uni-dos) -> code review (wayland)
158 @TheLastVoyager -> code review

163 Vũ Xuân Trường (@wanwanvxt) -> code review (winapi)
164 Lucas (@lightspeedlucas) -> code review (msvc++)
165 Jeffery Myers (@JeffM2501) -> code review (msvc)
166 Zeni (@zenitsuyo) -> documentation
167 TheYahton (@TheYahton) -> documentation
168 nonexistant_object (@DiarrheaMcgee

171#if _MSC_VER
172 #pragma comment(lib, "gdi32")
173 #pragma comment(lib, "shell32")
174 #pragma comment(lib, "User32")
175 #pragma warning( push )
176 #pragma warning( disable : 4996 4191 4127)
177 #if _MSC_VER < 600
178 #define RGFW_C89
179 #endif
180#else
181 #if defined(__STDC__) && !defined(__STDC_VERSION__)
182 #define RGFW_C89
183 #endif
184#endif
185
186#if defined(RGFW_EGL) && !defined(RGFW_OPENGL)
187 #define RGFW_OPENGL
188#endif
189
190/* these OS macros look better & are standardized */
191/* plus it helps with cross-compiling */
192
193#ifdef __EMSCRIPTEN__
194 #define RGFW_WASM
195#endif
196
197#if defined(RGFW_X11) && defined(__APPLE__) && !defined(RGFW_CUSTOM_BACKEND)
198 #define RGFW_MACOS_X11
199 #define RGFW_UNIX
200#endif
201
202#if defined(_WIN32) && !defined(RGFW_X11) && !defined(RGFW_UNIX) && !defined(RGFW_WASM) && !defined(RGFW_CUSTOM_BACKEND) /* (if you're using X11 on windows some how) */
203 #define RGFW_WINDOWS
204#endif
205#if defined(RGFW_WAYLAND)
206 #define RGFW_DEBUG /* wayland will be in debug mode by default for now */
207 #define RGFW_UNIX
208 #ifdef RGFW_OPENGL
209 #define RGFW_EGL
210 #endif
211 #ifdef RGFW_X11
212 #define RGFW_DYNAMIC
213 #endif
214#endif
215#if (!defined(RGFW_WAYLAND) && !defined(RGFW_X11)) && (defined(__unix__) || defined(RGFW_MACOS_X11) || defined(RGFW_X11)) && !defined(RGFW_WASM) && !defined(RGFW_CUSTOM_BACKEND)
216 #define RGFW_MACOS_X11
217 #define RGFW_X11
218 #define RGFW_UNIX
219#elif defined(__APPLE__) && !defined(RGFW_MACOS_X11) && !defined(RGFW_X11) && !defined(RGFW_WASM) && !defined(RGFW_CUSTOM_BACKEND)
220 #define RGFW_MACOS
221#endif
222
223#if !defined(RGFW_SNPRINTF) && (defined(RGFW_X11) || defined(RGFW_WAYLAND))
224 /* required for X11 errors */
225 #include <stdio.h>
226 #define RGFW_SNPRINTF snprintf
227#endif
228
229#ifndef RGFW_USERPTR
230 #define RGFW_USERPTR NULL
231#endif
232
233#ifndef RGFW_UNUSED
234 #define RGFW_UNUSED(x) (void)(x)
235#endif
236
237#ifndef RGFW_ROUND
238 #define RGFW_ROUND(x) (i32)((x) >= 0 ? (x) + 0.5f : (x) - 0.5f)
239#endif
240
241#ifndef RGFW_MIN
242 #define RGFW_MIN(x, y) ((x < y) ? x : y)
243#endif
244
245#ifndef RGFW_ALLOC
246 #include <stdlib.h>
247 #define RGFW_ALLOC malloc
248 #define RGFW_FREE free
249#endif
250
251#ifndef RGFW_ASSERT
252 #include <assert.h>
253 #define RGFW_ASSERT assert
254#endif
255
256#if !defined(RGFW_MEMCPY) || !defined(RGFW_STRNCMP) || !defined(RGFW_STRNCPY) || !defined(RGFW_MEMSET)
257 #include <string.h>
258#endif
259
260#ifndef RGFW_MEMSET
261 #define RGFW_MEMSET(ptr, value, num) memset(ptr, value, num)
262#endif
263
264#ifndef RGFW_MEMCPY
265 #define RGFW_MEMCPY(dist, src, len) memcpy(dist, src, len)
266#endif
267
268#ifndef RGFW_STRNCMP
269 #define RGFW_STRNCMP(s1, s2, max) strncmp(s1, s2, max)
270#endif
271
272#ifndef RGFW_STRNCPY
273 #define RGFW_STRNCPY(dist, src, len) strncpy(dist, src, len)
274#endif
275
276#ifndef RGFW_STRSTR
277 #define RGFW_STRSTR(str, substr) strstr(str, substr)
278#endif
279
280#ifndef RGFW_STRTOL
281 /* required for X11 XDnD and X11 Monitor DPI */
282 #include <stdlib.h>
283 #define RGFW_STRTOL(str, endptr, base) strtol(str, endptr, base)
284 #define RGFW_ATOF(num) atof(num)
285#endif
286
287#if !defined(RGFW_PRINTF) && ( defined(RGFW_DEBUG) || defined(RGFW_WAYLAND) )
288 /* required when using RGFW_DEBUG */
289 #include <stdio.h>
290 #define RGFW_PRINTF printf
291#endif
292
293#ifndef RGFW_MAX_PATH
294 #define RGFW_MAX_PATH 260 /* max length of a path (for drag andn drop) */
295#endif
296#ifndef RGFW_MAX_DROPS
297 #define RGFW_MAX_DROPS 260 /* max items you can drop at once */
298#endif
299
300#ifndef RGFW_COCOA_FRAME_NAME
301 #define RGFW_COCOA_FRAME_NAME NULL
302#endif
303
304#ifdef RGFW_WIN95 /* for windows 95 testing (not that it really works) */
305 #define RGFW_NO_MONITOR
306 #define RGFW_NO_PASSTHROUGH
307#endif
308
309#if defined(RGFW_EXPORT) || defined(RGFW_IMPORT)
310 #if defined(_WIN32)
311 #if defined(__TINYC__) && (defined(RGFW_EXPORT) || defined(RGFW_IMPORT))
312 #define __declspec(x) __attribute__((x))
313 #endif
314
315 #if defined(RGFW_EXPORT)
316 #define RGFWDEF __declspec(dllexport)
317 #else
318 #define RGFWDEF __declspec(dllimport)
319 #endif
320 #else
321 #if defined(RGFW_EXPORT)
322 #define RGFWDEF __attribute__((visibility("default")))
323 #endif
324 #endif
325 #ifndef RGFWDEF
326 #define RGFWDEF
327 #endif
328#endif
329
330#ifndef RGFWDEF
331 #ifdef RGFW_C89
332 #define RGFWDEF __inline
333 #else
334 #define RGFWDEF inline
335 #endif
336#endif
337
338#if defined(__cplusplus) && !defined(__EMSCRIPTEN__)
339 extern "C" {
340#endif
341
342 /* makes sure the header file part is only defined once by default */
343#ifndef RGFW_HEADER
344
345#define RGFW_HEADER
346
347#include <stddef.h>
348#ifndef RGFW_INT_DEFINED
349 #ifdef RGFW_USE_INT /* optional for any system that might not have stdint.h */
350 typedef unsigned char u8;
351 typedef signed char i8;
352 typedef unsigned short u16;
353 typedef signed short i16;
354 typedef unsigned long int u32;
355 typedef signed long int i32;
356 typedef unsigned long long u64;
357 typedef signed long long i64;
358 #else /* use stdint standard types instead of c "standard" types */
359 #include <stdint.h>
360
361 typedef uint8_t u8;
362 typedef int8_t i8;
363 typedef uint16_t u16;
364 typedef int16_t i16;
365 typedef uint32_t u32;
366 typedef int32_t i32;
367 typedef uint64_t u64;
368 typedef int64_t i64;
369 #endif
370 #define RGFW_INT_DEFINED
371#endif
372
373#ifndef RGFW_BOOL_DEFINED
374 #define RGFW_BOOL_DEFINED
375 typedef u8 RGFW_bool;
376#endif
377
378#define RGFW_BOOL(x) (RGFW_bool)((x) != 0) /* force a value to be 0 or 1 */
379#define RGFW_TRUE (RGFW_bool)1
380#define RGFW_FALSE (RGFW_bool)0
381
382#define RGFW_ENUM(type, name) type name; enum
383#define RGFW_BIT(x) (1 << (x))
384
385/* runs whatever RGFW_ALLOC was/is at compile time */
386RGFWDEF void* RGFW_alloc(size_t size);
387/* runs whatever RGFW_FREE was/is at compile time */
388RGFWDEF void RGFW_free(void* ptr);
389
390typedef struct RGFW_window RGFW_window;
391typedef struct RGFW_window_src RGFW_window_src;
392
393
394RGFWDEF size_t RGFW_sizeofWindow(void);
395RGFWDEF size_t RGFW_sizeofWindowSrc(void);
396
400RGFWDEF void RGFW_useWayland(RGFW_bool wayland);
401RGFWDEF RGFW_bool RGFW_usingWayland(void);
402
406RGFWDEF void* RGFW_getLayer_OSX(void);
407RGFWDEF void* RGFW_getDisplay_X11(void);
408RGFWDEF struct wl_display* RGFW_getDisplay_Wayland(void);
409
414RGFWDEF void RGFW_setClassName(const char* name);
415RGFWDEF void RGFW_setXInstName(const char* name);
418RGFWDEF void RGFW_moveToMacOSResourceDir(void);
419
420typedef RGFW_ENUM(u8, RGFW_format) {
421 RGFW_formatRGB8 = 0,
422 RGFW_formatBGR8,
423 RGFW_formatRGBA8,
424 RGFW_formatARGB8,
425 RGFW_formatBGRA8,
426 RGFW_formatABGR8,
427 RGFW_formatCount
428};
429
431RGFWDEF void RGFW_copyImageData(u8* dest_data, i32 w, i32 h, RGFW_format dest_format, u8* src_data, RGFW_format src_format);
432
433typedef struct RGFW_nativeImage RGFW_nativeImage;
434RGFWDEF size_t RGFW_sizeofNativeImage(void);
435
436typedef struct RGFW_surface RGFW_surface;
437RGFWDEF size_t RGFW_sizeofSurface(void);
438
439/*
440 * NOTE: when you create a surface using RGFW_createSurface / ptr, on X11 it uses the root window's visual
441 * this means it may fail to render on any other window if the visual does not match
442 * RGFW_window_createSurface and RGFW_window_createSurfacePtr exist only for X11 to address this issues
443 * Of course, you can also manually set the root window with RGFW_setRootWindow
444 */
445RGFWDEF RGFW_surface* RGFW_createSurface(u8* data, i32 w, i32 h, RGFW_format format);
446RGFWDEF RGFW_bool RGFW_createSurfacePtr(u8* data, i32 w, i32 h, RGFW_format format, RGFW_surface* surface);
447
448RGFWDEF RGFW_nativeImage* RGFW_surface_getNativeImage(RGFW_surface* surface);
449
451RGFWDEF void RGFW_surface_free(RGFW_surface* surface);
453RGFWDEF void RGFW_surface_freePtr(RGFW_surface* surface);
454
455/* RGFW mouse loading */
456typedef void RGFW_mouse;
457
459RGFWDEF RGFW_mouse* RGFW_loadMouse(u8* data, i32 w, i32 h, RGFW_format format);
461RGFWDEF void RGFW_freeMouse(RGFW_mouse* mouse);
462
463#ifndef RGFW_NO_MONITOR
464 #ifndef RGFW_MAX_MONITORS
465 #define RGFW_MAX_MONITORS 6
466 #endif
467 /* monitor mode data | can be changed by the user (with functions)*/
468 typedef struct RGFW_monitorMode {
469 i32 w, h;
470 u32 refreshRate;
471 u8 red, blue, green;
472 } RGFW_monitorMode;
473
475 typedef struct RGFW_monitor {
476 i32 x, y;
477 char name[128];
478 float scaleX, scaleY;
479 float pixelRatio;
480 float physW, physH;
481 RGFW_monitorMode mode;
482 } RGFW_monitor;
483
485 RGFWDEF RGFW_monitor* RGFW_getMonitors(size_t* len);
487 RGFWDEF RGFW_monitor RGFW_getPrimaryMonitor(void);
488
489 typedef RGFW_ENUM(u8, RGFW_modeRequest) {
490 RGFW_monitorScale = RGFW_BIT(0),
491 RGFW_monitorRefresh = RGFW_BIT(1),
492 RGFW_monitorRGB = RGFW_BIT(2),
493 RGFW_monitorAll = RGFW_monitorScale | RGFW_monitorRefresh | RGFW_monitorRGB
494 };
495
497 RGFWDEF RGFW_bool RGFW_monitor_requestMode(RGFW_monitor mon, RGFW_monitorMode mode, RGFW_modeRequest request);
499 RGFWDEF RGFW_bool RGFW_monitorModeCompare(RGFW_monitorMode mon, RGFW_monitorMode mon2, RGFW_modeRequest request);
501 RGFWDEF RGFW_bool RGFW_monitor_scaleToWindow(RGFW_monitor mon, struct RGFW_window* win);
502#endif
503
507typedef RGFW_ENUM(u8, RGFW_key) {
508 RGFW_keyNULL = 0,
509 RGFW_escape = '\033',
510 RGFW_backtick = '`',
511 RGFW_0 = '0',
512 RGFW_1 = '1',
513 RGFW_2 = '2',
514 RGFW_3 = '3',
515 RGFW_4 = '4',
516 RGFW_5 = '5',
517 RGFW_6 = '6',
518 RGFW_7 = '7',
519 RGFW_8 = '8',
520 RGFW_9 = '9',
521 RGFW_minus = '-',
522 RGFW_equals = '=',
523 RGFW_backSpace = '\b',
524 RGFW_tab = '\t',
525 RGFW_space = ' ',
526 RGFW_a = 'a',
527 RGFW_b = 'b',
528 RGFW_c = 'c',
529 RGFW_d = 'd',
530 RGFW_e = 'e',
531 RGFW_f = 'f',
532 RGFW_g = 'g',
533 RGFW_h = 'h',
534 RGFW_i = 'i',
535 RGFW_j = 'j',
536 RGFW_k = 'k',
537 RGFW_l = 'l',
538 RGFW_m = 'm',
539 RGFW_n = 'n',
540 RGFW_o = 'o',
541 RGFW_p = 'p',
542 RGFW_q = 'q',
543 RGFW_r = 'r',
544 RGFW_s = 's',
545 RGFW_t = 't',
546 RGFW_u = 'u',
547 RGFW_v = 'v',
548 RGFW_w = 'w',
549 RGFW_x = 'x',
550 RGFW_y = 'y',
551 RGFW_z = 'z',
552 RGFW_period = '.',
553 RGFW_comma = ',',
554 RGFW_slash = '/',
555 RGFW_bracket = '[',
556 RGFW_closeBracket = ']',
557 RGFW_semicolon = ';',
558 RGFW_apostrophe = '\'',
559 RGFW_backSlash = '\\',
560 RGFW_return = '\n',
561 RGFW_enter = RGFW_return,
562 RGFW_delete = '\177', /* 127 */
563 RGFW_F1,

566 RGFW_F4,

590 RGFW_controlL,
591 RGFW_altL,
592 RGFW_superL,
593 RGFW_shiftR,
594 RGFW_controlR,
595 RGFW_altR,
596 RGFW_superR,
597 RGFW_up,
598 RGFW_down,
599 RGFW_left,
600 RGFW_right,
601 RGFW_insert,
602 RGFW_menu,
603 RGFW_end,
604 RGFW_home,
605 RGFW_pageUp,

620 RGFW_kp8,
621 RGFW_kp9,
622 RGFW_kp0,
623 RGFW_kpPeriod,
624 RGFW_kpReturn,
625 RGFW_scrollLock,
626 RGFW_printScreen,
627 RGFW_pause,
628 RGFW_world1,
629 RGFW_world2,
630 RGFW_keyLast = 256 /* padding for alignment ~(175 by default) */
631};
632
634typedef RGFW_ENUM(u8, RGFW_mouseButton) {
635 RGFW_mouseLeft = 0,
636 RGFW_mouseMiddle,
637 RGFW_mouseRight,
638 RGFW_mouseMisc1, RGFW_mouseMisc2, RGFW_mouseMisc3, RGFW_mouseMisc4, RGFW_mouseMisc5,
639 RGFW_mouseFinal
640};
641
642/* for RGFW_event.lockstate */
643typedef RGFW_ENUM(u8, RGFW_keymod) {
644 RGFW_modCapsLock = RGFW_BIT(0),
645 RGFW_modNumLock = RGFW_BIT(1),
646 RGFW_modControl = RGFW_BIT(2),
647 RGFW_modAlt = RGFW_BIT(3),
648 RGFW_modShift = RGFW_BIT(4),
649 RGFW_modSuper = RGFW_BIT(5),
650 RGFW_modScrollLock = RGFW_BIT(6)
651};
652
653typedef RGFW_ENUM(u8, RGFW_eventType) {
655 RGFW_eventNone = 0,
656 RGFW_keyPressed, /* a key has been pressed */
657 RGFW_keyReleased,
669 RGFW_mouseButtonPressed,
670 RGFW_mouseButtonReleased,
671 RGFW_mouseScroll,
672 RGFW_mousePosChanged,
678 RGFW_windowMoved,
679 RGFW_windowResized,
680 RGFW_focusIn,
681 RGFW_focusOut,
682 RGFW_mouseEnter, /* mouse entered the window */
683 RGFW_mouseLeave, /* mouse left the window */
684 RGFW_windowRefresh, /* The window content needs to be refreshed */
685
686 /* attribs change event note
687 The event data is sent straight to the window structure
688 with win->x, win->y, win->w and win->h
689 */
690 RGFW_quit,
691 RGFW_dataDrop,
692 RGFW_dataDrag,
693 /* drop data note
694 The x and y coords of the drop are stored in the vector RGFW_x, y
695
696 RGFW_event.drop.count holds how many files were dropped
697
698 This is also the size of the array which stores all the dropped file string,
699 RGFW_event.drop.files
700 */
701 RGFW_windowMaximized,
702 RGFW_windowMinimized,
703 RGFW_windowRestored,
704 RGFW_scaleUpdated
705};
706
707
708typedef RGFW_ENUM(u32, RGFW_eventFlag) {
709 RGFW_keyPressedFlag = RGFW_BIT(RGFW_keyPressed),
710 RGFW_keyReleasedFlag = RGFW_BIT(RGFW_keyReleased),
711 RGFW_mouseScrollFlag = RGFW_BIT(RGFW_mouseScroll),
712 RGFW_mouseButtonPressedFlag = RGFW_BIT(RGFW_mouseButtonPressed),
713 RGFW_mouseButtonReleasedFlag = RGFW_BIT(RGFW_mouseButtonReleased),
714 RGFW_mousePosChangedFlag = RGFW_BIT(RGFW_mousePosChanged),
715 RGFW_mouseEnterFlag = RGFW_BIT(RGFW_mouseEnter),
716 RGFW_mouseLeaveFlag = RGFW_BIT(RGFW_mouseLeave),
717 RGFW_windowMovedFlag = RGFW_BIT(RGFW_windowMoved),
718 RGFW_windowResizedFlag = RGFW_BIT(RGFW_windowResized),
719 RGFW_focusInFlag = RGFW_BIT(RGFW_focusIn),
720 RGFW_focusOutFlag = RGFW_BIT(RGFW_focusOut),
721 RGFW_windowRefreshFlag = RGFW_BIT(RGFW_windowRefresh),
722 RGFW_windowMaximizedFlag = RGFW_BIT(RGFW_windowMaximized),
723 RGFW_windowMinimizedFlag = RGFW_BIT(RGFW_windowMinimized),
724 RGFW_windowRestoredFlag = RGFW_BIT(RGFW_windowRestored),
725 RGFW_scaleUpdatedFlag = RGFW_BIT(RGFW_scaleUpdated),
726 RGFW_quitFlag = RGFW_BIT(RGFW_quit),
727 RGFW_dataDropFlag = RGFW_BIT(RGFW_dataDrop),
728 RGFW_dataDragFlag = RGFW_BIT(RGFW_dataDrag),
729
730 RGFW_keyEventsFlag = RGFW_keyPressedFlag | RGFW_keyReleasedFlag,
731 RGFW_mouseEventsFlag = RGFW_mouseButtonPressedFlag | RGFW_mouseButtonReleasedFlag | RGFW_mousePosChangedFlag | RGFW_mouseEnterFlag | RGFW_mouseLeaveFlag | RGFW_mouseScrollFlag ,
732 RGFW_windowEventsFlag = RGFW_windowMovedFlag | RGFW_windowResizedFlag | RGFW_windowRefreshFlag | RGFW_windowMaximizedFlag | RGFW_windowMinimizedFlag | RGFW_windowRestoredFlag | RGFW_scaleUpdatedFlag,
733 RGFW_focusEventsFlag = RGFW_focusInFlag | RGFW_focusOutFlag,
734 RGFW_dataDropEventsFlag = RGFW_dataDropFlag | RGFW_dataDragFlag,
735 RGFW_allEventFlags = RGFW_keyEventsFlag | RGFW_mouseEventsFlag | RGFW_windowEventsFlag | RGFW_focusEventsFlag | RGFW_dataDropEventsFlag | RGFW_quitFlag
736};
737
739typedef struct RGFW_commonEvent {
740 RGFW_eventType type;
741 RGFW_window* win;
742} RGFW_commonEvent;
743
744typedef struct RGFW_mouseButtonEvent {
745 RGFW_eventType type;
746 RGFW_window* win;
747 u8 value; /* !< which mouse button was pressed */
748} RGFW_mouseButtonEvent;
749
750typedef struct RGFW_mouseScrollEvent {
751 RGFW_eventType type;
752 RGFW_window* win;
753 float x, y;
754} RGFW_mouseScrollEvent;
755
756typedef struct RGFW_mousePosEvent {
757 RGFW_eventType type;
758 RGFW_window* win;
759 i32 x, y;
760 float vecX, vecY;
761} RGFW_mousePosEvent;
762
763typedef struct RGFW_keyEvent {
764 RGFW_eventType type;
765 RGFW_window* win;
766 RGFW_key value;
767 u8 sym;
768 RGFW_bool repeat;
769 RGFW_keymod mod;
770} RGFW_keyEvent;
771
772typedef struct RGFW_dataDropEvent {
773 RGFW_eventType type;
774 RGFW_window* win;
775 /* 260 max paths with a max length of 260 */
776 char** files;
777 size_t count;
778} RGFW_dataDropEvent;
779
780typedef struct RGFW_dataDragEvent {
781 RGFW_eventType type;
782 RGFW_window* win;
783 i32 x, y;
784} RGFW_dataDragEvent;
785
786typedef struct RGFW_scaleUpdatedEvent {
787 RGFW_eventType type;
788 RGFW_window* win;
789 float x, y;
790} RGFW_scaleUpdatedEvent;
791
793typedef union RGFW_event {
794 RGFW_eventType type;
795 RGFW_commonEvent common;
796 RGFW_mouseButtonEvent button;
797 RGFW_mouseScrollEvent scroll;
798 RGFW_mousePosEvent mouse;
799 RGFW_keyEvent key;
800 RGFW_dataDropEvent drop;
801 RGFW_dataDragEvent drag; /* data for dragging a file events */
802 RGFW_scaleUpdatedEvent scale; /* data for monitor scaling events */
803} RGFW_event;
804
812typedef RGFW_ENUM(i32, RGFW_eventWait) {
813 RGFW_eventNoWait = 0,
814 RGFW_eventWaitNext = -1
815};
816
818RGFWDEF void RGFW_waitForEvent(i32 waitMS);
819
823RGFWDEF void RGFW_setQueueEvents(RGFW_bool queue);
824
829RGFWDEF void RGFW_pollEvents(void);
830
834RGFWDEF void RGFW_stopCheckEvents(void);
835
839RGFWDEF RGFW_bool RGFW_isKeyPressed(RGFW_key key);
841RGFWDEF RGFW_bool RGFW_isKeyDown(RGFW_key key);
842RGFWDEF RGFW_bool RGFW_isKeyReleased(RGFW_key key);
845RGFWDEF RGFW_bool RGFW_isMousePressed(RGFW_mouseButton button );
847RGFWDEF RGFW_bool RGFW_isMouseDown(RGFW_mouseButton button );
849RGFWDEF RGFW_bool RGFW_isMouseReleased(RGFW_mouseButton button );
851RGFWDEF void RGFW_getMouseScroll(float* x, float* y);
853RGFWDEF void RGFW_getMouseVector(float* x, float* y);
857typedef RGFW_ENUM(u32, RGFW_windowFlags) {
858 RGFW_windowNoBorder = RGFW_BIT(0),
859 RGFW_windowNoResize = RGFW_BIT(1),
860 RGFW_windowAllowDND = RGFW_BIT(2),
861 RGFW_windowHideMouse = RGFW_BIT(3),
862 RGFW_windowFullscreen = RGFW_BIT(4),
863 RGFW_windowTransparent = RGFW_BIT(5),
864 RGFW_windowCenter = RGFW_BIT(6),
865 RGFW_windowScaleToMonitor = RGFW_BIT(8),
866 RGFW_windowHide = RGFW_BIT(9),
867 RGFW_windowMaximize = RGFW_BIT(10),
868 RGFW_windowCenterCursor = RGFW_BIT(11),
869 RGFW_windowFloating = RGFW_BIT(12),
870 RGFW_windowFocusOnShow = RGFW_BIT(13),
871 RGFW_windowMinimize = RGFW_BIT(14),
872 RGFW_windowFocus = RGFW_BIT(15),
873 RGFW_windowOpenGL = RGFW_BIT(17),
874 RGFW_windowEGL = RGFW_BIT(18),
875 RGFW_windowedFullscreen = RGFW_windowNoBorder | RGFW_windowMaximize
876};

878/* NOTE: (windows) if the executable has an icon resource named RGFW_ICON, it will be set as the initial icon for the window */
879
880RGFWDEF RGFW_window* RGFW_createWindow(
881 const char* name, /* name of the window */
882 i32 x, i32 y, /* position of the window */
883 i32 w, i32 h, /* size of the window */
884 RGFW_windowFlags flags /* extra arguments ((u32)0 means no flags used)*/
885);
887RGFWDEF RGFW_window* RGFW_createWindowPtr(
888 const char* name, /* name of the window */
889 i32 x, i32 y, /* position of the window */
890 i32 w, i32 h, /* size of the window */
891 RGFW_windowFlags flags, /* extra arguments (NULL / (u32)0 means no flags used) */
892 RGFW_window* win/* ptr to the fat window struct you want to use */
893);
896/*
897 * NOTE: when you create a surface using RGFW_createSurface / ptr, on X11 it uses the root window's visual
898 * this means it may fail to render on any other window if the visual does not match
899 * RGFW_window_createSurface and RGFW_window_createSurfacePtr exist only for X11 to address this issues
900 * Of course, you can also manually set the root window with RGFW_setRootWindow
901 */
902RGFWDEF RGFW_surface* RGFW_window_createSurface(RGFW_window* win, u8* data, i32 w, i32 h, RGFW_format format);
903RGFWDEF RGFW_bool RGFW_window_createSurfacePtr(RGFW_window* win, u8* data, i32 w, i32 h, RGFW_format format, RGFW_surface* surface);
904
906RGFWDEF void RGFW_window_blitSurface(RGFW_window* win, RGFW_surface* surface);
907
908RGFWDEF RGFW_bool RGFW_window_getPosition(RGFW_window* win, i32* x, i32* y);
909RGFWDEF RGFW_bool RGFW_window_getSize(RGFW_window* win, i32* w, i32* h);
911RGFWDEF u32 RGFW_window_getFlags(RGFW_window* win);
913RGFWDEF RGFW_key RGFW_window_getExitKey(RGFW_window* win);
914RGFWDEF void RGFW_window_setExitKey(RGFW_window* win, RGFW_key key);
917RGFWDEF void RGFW_window_setEnabledEvents(RGFW_window* win, RGFW_eventFlag events);
919RGFWDEF RGFW_eventFlag RGFW_window_getEnabledEvents(RGFW_window* win);
921RGFWDEF void RGFW_window_setDisabledEvents(RGFW_window* win, RGFW_eventFlag events);
923RGFWDEF void RGFW_window_setEventState(RGFW_window* win, RGFW_eventFlag event, RGFW_bool state);

931 * (e.g. when trying to get OSX data on Windows) */
932RGFWDEF void RGFW_window_setLayer_OSX(RGFW_window* win, void* layer);

1159typedef RGFW_ENUM(u8, RGFW_debugType) {
1160 RGFW_typeError = 0, RGFW_typeWarning, RGFW_typeInfo
1161};
1162
1163typedef RGFW_ENUM(u8, RGFW_errorCode) {
1164 RGFW_noError = 0,
1165 RGFW_errOutOfMemory,
1166 RGFW_errOpenGLContext, RGFW_errEGLContext,
1167 RGFW_errWayland, RGFW_errX11,
1168 RGFW_errDirectXContext,
1169 RGFW_errIOKit,
1170 RGFW_errClipboard,
1171 RGFW_errFailedFuncLoad,
1172 RGFW_errBuffer,
1173 RGFW_errEventQueue,
1174 RGFW_infoMonitor, RGFW_infoWindow, RGFW_infoBuffer, RGFW_infoGlobal, RGFW_infoOpenGL,
1175 RGFW_warningWayland, RGFW_warningOpenGL
1176};

1178typedef void (* RGFW_debugfunc)(RGFW_debugType type, RGFW_errorCode err, const char* msg);
1179RGFWDEF RGFW_debugfunc RGFW_setDebugCallback(RGFW_debugfunc func);
1180RGFWDEF void RGFW_sendDebugInfo(RGFW_debugType type, RGFW_errorCode err, const char* msg);
1195typedef void (* RGFW_windowMovedfunc)(RGFW_window* win, i32 x, i32 y);
1197typedef void (* RGFW_windowResizedfunc)(RGFW_window* win, i32 w, i32 h);
1199typedef void (* RGFW_windowRestoredfunc)(RGFW_window* win, i32 x, i32 y, i32 w, i32 h);
1201typedef void (* RGFW_windowMaximizedfunc)(RGFW_window* win, i32 x, i32 y, i32 w, i32 h);
1203typedef void (* RGFW_windowMinimizedfunc)(RGFW_window* win);
1205typedef void (* RGFW_windowQuitfunc)(RGFW_window* win);
1207typedef void (* RGFW_focusfunc)(RGFW_window* win, RGFW_bool inFocus);
1209typedef void (* RGFW_mouseNotifyfunc)(RGFW_window* win, i32 x, i32 y, RGFW_bool status);
1211typedef void (* RGFW_mousePosfunc)(RGFW_window* win, i32 x, i32 y, float vecX, float vecY);
1213typedef void (* RGFW_dataDragfunc)(RGFW_window* win, i32 x, i32 y);
1215typedef void (* RGFW_windowRefreshfunc)(RGFW_window* win);
1217typedef void (* RGFW_keyfunc)(RGFW_window* win, u8 key, u8 sym, RGFW_keymod mod, RGFW_bool repeat, RGFW_bool pressed);
1219typedef void (* RGFW_mouseButtonfunc)(RGFW_window* win, RGFW_mouseButton button, RGFW_bool pressed);
1221typedef void (* RGFW_mouseScrollfunc)(RGFW_window* win, float x, float y);
1223typedef void (* RGFW_dataDropfunc)(RGFW_window* win, char** files, size_t count);
1225typedef void (* RGFW_scaleUpdatedfunc)(RGFW_window* win, float scaleX, float scaleY);
1226
1228RGFWDEF RGFW_windowMovedfunc RGFW_setWindowMovedCallback(RGFW_windowMovedfunc func);
1230RGFWDEF RGFW_windowResizedfunc RGFW_setWindowResizedCallback(RGFW_windowResizedfunc func);
1232RGFWDEF RGFW_windowQuitfunc RGFW_setWindowQuitCallback(RGFW_windowQuitfunc func);
1234RGFWDEF RGFW_mousePosfunc RGFW_setMousePosCallback(RGFW_mousePosfunc func);
1236RGFWDEF RGFW_windowRefreshfunc RGFW_setWindowRefreshCallback(RGFW_windowRefreshfunc func);
1238RGFWDEF RGFW_focusfunc RGFW_setFocusCallback(RGFW_focusfunc func);
1240RGFWDEF RGFW_mouseNotifyfunc RGFW_setMouseNotifyCallback(RGFW_mouseNotifyfunc func);
1242RGFWDEF RGFW_dataDropfunc RGFW_setDataDropCallback(RGFW_dataDropfunc func);
1244RGFWDEF RGFW_dataDragfunc RGFW_setDataDragCallback(RGFW_dataDragfunc func);
1246RGFWDEF RGFW_keyfunc RGFW_setKeyCallback(RGFW_keyfunc func);
1248RGFWDEF RGFW_mouseButtonfunc RGFW_setMouseButtonCallback(RGFW_mouseButtonfunc func);
1250RGFWDEF RGFW_mouseScrollfunc RGFW_setMouseScrollCallback(RGFW_mouseScrollfunc func);
1252RGFWDEF RGFW_windowMaximizedfunc RGFW_setWindowMaximizedCallback(RGFW_windowMaximizedfunc func);
1254RGFWDEF RGFW_windowMinimizedfunc RGFW_setWindowMinimizedCallback(RGFW_windowMinimizedfunc func);
1256RGFWDEF RGFW_windowRestoredfunc RGFW_setWindowRestoredCallback(RGFW_windowRestoredfunc func);
1258RGFWDEF RGFW_scaleUpdatedfunc RGFW_setScaleUpdatedCallback(RGFW_scaleUpdatedfunc func);
1264typedef void (*RGFW_proc)(void); /* function pointer equivalent of void* */
1265
1267#if defined(RGFW_OPENGL)
1268typedef struct RGFW_glContext RGFW_glContext;
1269typedef struct RGFW_eglContext RGFW_eglContext;
1270
1272typedef RGFW_ENUM(i32, RGFW_glReleaseBehavior) { RGFW_glReleaseFlush = 0, RGFW_glReleaseNone };
1273typedef RGFW_ENUM(i32, RGFW_glProfile) { RGFW_glCore = 0, RGFW_glCompatibility, RGFW_glES};
1274typedef RGFW_ENUM(i32, RGFW_glRenderer) { RGFW_glAccelerated = 0, RGFW_glSoftware };
1275
1276typedef struct RGFW_glHints {
1277 i32 stencil;
1278 i32 samples;
1279 i32 stereo;
1280 i32 auxBuffers;
1281 i32 doubleBuffer;
1282 i32 red, green, blue, alpha;
1283 i32 depth;
1284 i32 accumRed, accumGreen, accumBlue, accumAlpha;
1285 RGFW_bool sRGB;
1286 RGFW_bool robustness;
1287 RGFW_bool debug;
1288 RGFW_bool noError;
1289 RGFW_glReleaseBehavior releaseBehavior;
1290 RGFW_glProfile profile;
1291 i32 major, minor;
1292 RGFW_glContext* share;
1293 RGFW_eglContext* shareEGL;
1294 RGFW_glRenderer renderer;
1295} RGFW_glHints;
1296
1298RGFWDEF void RGFW_setGlobalHints_OpenGL(RGFW_glHints* hints);
1300RGFWDEF void RGFW_resetGlobalHints_OpenGL(void);
1302RGFWDEF RGFW_glHints* RGFW_getGlobalHints_OpenGL(void);

1650typedef struct RGFW_windowInternal {
1652 RGFW_key exitKey;
1653 i32 lastMouseX, lastMouseY;
1655 RGFW_bool shouldClose;
1656 RGFW_bool holdMouse;
1657 RGFW_bool inFocus;
1658 RGFW_bool mouseInside;
1659 RGFW_keymod mod;
1660 RGFW_eventFlag enabledEvents;
1661 u32 flags;
1662 i32 oldX, oldY, oldW, oldH;
1663} RGFW_windowInternal;
1664
1665struct RGFW_window {
1666 RGFW_window_src src;
1667 RGFW_windowInternal internal;
1668 void* userPtr; /* ptr for usr data */
1669 i32 x, y, w, h;
1670};
1672typedef struct RGFW_windowState {
1673 RGFW_bool mouseEnter;
1674 RGFW_bool dataDragging;
1675 RGFW_bool dataDrop;
1676 size_t filesCount;
1677 i32 dropX, dropY;
1678 RGFW_window* win;
1680 RGFW_bool mouseLeave;
1681 RGFW_window* winLeave;
1682} RGFW_windowState;

1684typedef struct {
1685 RGFW_bool current;
1686 RGFW_bool prev;
1687} RGFW_keyState;

1689#ifndef RGFW_NO_MONITOR
1690 typedef struct RGFW_monitorNode {
1691 RGFW_monitor mon;
1692 struct RGFW_monitorNode* next;
1693#ifdef RGFW_WAYLAND
1694 u32 id; /* Add id so wl_outputs can be removed */
1695 struct wl_output *output;
1696 struct zxdg_output_v1 *xdg_output;
1697#endif
1698 } RGFW_monitorNode;
1699
1700 typedef struct RGFW_monitorList {
1701 RGFW_monitorNode* head;
1702 RGFW_monitorNode* cur;
1703 } RGFW_monitorList;
1704
1705 typedef struct RGFW_monitors {
1706 RGFW_monitorList list;
1707 RGFW_monitorList freeList;
1708 size_t count;
1709 RGFW_monitorNode data[RGFW_MAX_MONITORS];
1710 } RGFW_monitors;
1711
1712 RGFWDEF RGFW_monitorNode* RGFW_monitors_add(RGFW_monitor mon);
1713 RGFWDEF void RGFW_monitors_remove(RGFW_monitorNode* node, RGFW_monitorNode* prev);
1714#endif
1715
1716struct RGFW_info {
1717 RGFW_window* root;
1718 i32 windowCount;
1719 i32 eventLen;
1720
1721 RGFW_mouse* hiddenMouse;
1722 RGFW_event events[RGFW_MAX_EVENTS];
1723 RGFW_bool queueEvents;
1724 RGFW_bool polledEvents;
1725
1726 u32 apiKeycodes[RGFW_keyLast];
1727 #if defined(RGFW_X11) || defined(RGFW_WAYLAND)
1728 u8 keycodes[256];
1729 #elif defined(RGFW_WINDOWS)
1730 u8 keycodes[512];
1731 #elif defined(RGFW_MACOS)
1732 u8 keycodes[128];
1733 #elif defined(RGFW_WASM)
1734 u8 keycodes[256];
1735 #endif
1736
1737 const char* className;
1738 RGFW_bool useWaylandBool;
1739 RGFW_bool stopCheckEvents_bool ;
1740 u64 timerOffset;
1741
1742 char* clipboard_data;
1743 char filesSrc[RGFW_MAX_PATH * RGFW_MAX_DROPS];
1744 char** files;
1745 #ifdef RGFW_X11
1746 Display* display;
1747 XContext context;
1748 Window helperWindow;
1749 char* clipboard; /* for writing to the clipboard selection */
1750 size_t clipboard_len;
1751 const char* instName;
1752 XErrorEvent* x11Error;
1753 #endif
1754 #ifdef RGFW_WAYLAND
1755 struct wl_display* wl_display;
1756 struct xkb_context *xkb_context;
1757 struct xkb_keymap *keymap;
1758 struct xkb_state *xkb_state;
1759 struct zxdg_decoration_manager_v1 *decoration_manager;
1760 struct zxdg_output_manager_v1 *xdg_output_manager;
1761 struct wl_keyboard* wl_keyboard;
1762 struct wl_pointer* wl_pointer;
1763 struct wl_compositor* compositor;
1764 struct xdg_wm_base* xdg_wm_base;
1765 struct wl_shm* shm;
1766 struct wl_seat *seat;
1767 struct wl_registry *registry;
1768
1769 struct wl_cursor_theme* wl_cursor_theme;
1770 struct wl_surface* cursor_surface;
1771 struct wl_cursor_image* cursor_image;
1772 RGFW_window* kbOwner;
1773
1774 #endif
1775
1776 RGFW_monitors monitors;
1777
1778 #ifdef __linux__
1779 int eventWait_forceStop[3];
1780 #endif
1781
1782 #ifdef RGFW_MACOS
1783 void* NSApp;
1784 void* customViewClasses[2]; /* NSView and NSOpenGLView */
1785 void* customWindowDelegateClass;
1786 #endif
1787
1788 #ifdef RGFW_OPENGL
1789 RGFW_window* current;
1790 #endif
1791 #ifdef RGFW_EGL
1792 void* EGL_display;
1793 #endif
1794
1795 RGFW_window* mouseOwner;
1796 RGFW_windowState windowState;
1798 RGFW_keyState mouseButtons[RGFW_mouseFinal];
1799 RGFW_keyState keyboard[RGFW_keyLast];
1800 float scrollX, scrollY;
1801 float vectorX, vectorY;
1802};
1803#endif /* RGFW_NATIVE_HEADER */

1840} RGFW_attribStack;
1841RGFWDEF void RGFW_attribStack_init(RGFW_attribStack* stack, i32* attribs, size_t max);
1842RGFWDEF void RGFW_attribStack_pushAttrib(RGFW_attribStack* stack, i32 attrib);
1843RGFWDEF void RGFW_attribStack_pushAttribs(RGFW_attribStack* stack, i32 attrib1, i32 attrib2);
1844
1845RGFWDEF RGFW_bool RGFW_extensionSupportedStr(const char* extensions, const char* ext, size_t len);
1846#endif
1847
1848typedef struct RGFW_colorLayout { i32 r, g, b, a; } RGFW_colorLayout;
1849
1850#ifdef RGFW_X11
1851RGFWDEF void RGFW_XCreateWindow (XVisualInfo visual, const char* name, RGFW_windowFlags flags, RGFW_window* win);
1852#endif
1853#ifdef RGFW_MACOS
1854RGFWDEF void RGFW_osx_initView(RGFW_window* win);
1855#endif
1856/* end of global private API defs */
1857
1858RGFW_info* _RGFW = NULL;
1859void RGFW_setInfo(RGFW_info* info) { _RGFW = info; }
1860RGFW_info* RGFW_getInfo(void) { return _RGFW; }
1861
1862
1863void* RGFW_alloc(size_t size) { return RGFW_ALLOC(size); }
1864void RGFW_free(void* ptr) { RGFW_FREE(ptr); }
1865
1866void RGFW_useWayland(RGFW_bool wayland) { RGFW_init(); _RGFW->useWaylandBool = RGFW_BOOL(wayland); }
1867RGFW_bool RGFW_usingWayland(void) { return _RGFW->useWaylandBool; }
1868
1869void RGFW_clipboard_switch(char* newstr);
1870void RGFW_clipboard_switch(char* newstr) {
1871 if (_RGFW->clipboard_data != NULL)
1872 RGFW_FREE(_RGFW->clipboard_data);
1873 _RGFW->clipboard_data = newstr;
1874}
1875
1876#define RGFW_CHECK_CLIPBOARD() \
1877 if (size <= 0 && _RGFW->clipboard_data != NULL) \
1878 return (const char*)_RGFW->clipboard_data; \
1879 else if (size <= 0) \
1880 return "\0";
1881
1882const char* RGFW_readClipboard(size_t* len) {
1883 RGFW_ssize_t size = RGFW_readClipboardPtr(NULL, 0);
1884 RGFW_CHECK_CLIPBOARD();
1885 char* str = (char*)RGFW_ALLOC((size_t)size);
1886 RGFW_ASSERT(str != NULL);
1887 str[0] = '\0';
1888
1889 size = RGFW_readClipboardPtr(str, (size_t)size);
1890
1891 RGFW_CHECK_CLIPBOARD();
1892
1893 if (len != NULL) *len = (size_t)size;
1894
1895 RGFW_clipboard_switch(str);
1896 return (const char*)str;
1897}
1898
1899/*
1900RGFW_IMPLEMENTATION starts with generic RGFW defines
1901
1902This is the start of keycode data
1903*/
1904
1905
1906
1907void RGFW_initKeycodes(void) {
1908 RGFW_MEMSET(_RGFW->keycodes, 0, sizeof(_RGFW->keycodes));
1909 RGFW_initKeycodesPlatform();
1910 u32 i, y;
1911 for (i = 0; i < RGFW_keyLast; i++) {
1912 for (y = 0; y < sizeof(_RGFW->keycodes); y++) {
1913 if (_RGFW->keycodes[y] == i) {
1914 _RGFW->apiKeycodes[i] = y;
1915 break;
1916 }
1917 }
1918 }
1919
1920
1921 RGFW_resetKey();
1922}
1923
1924u32 RGFW_apiKeyToRGFW(u32 keycode) {
1925 /* make sure the key isn't out of bounds */
1926 if (keycode > sizeof(_RGFW->keycodes) / sizeof(u8))
1927 return 0;
1928
1929 return _RGFW->keycodes[keycode];
1930}
1931
1932u32 RGFW_rgfwToApiKey(u32 keycode) {
1933 /* make sure the key isn't out of bounds */
1934 if (keycode > sizeof(_RGFW->apiKeycodes) / sizeof(u32))
1935 return 0;
1936
1937 return _RGFW->apiKeycodes[keycode];
1938}
1939
1940void RGFW_resetKey(void) { RGFW_MEMSET(_RGFW->keyboard, 0, sizeof(_RGFW->keyboard)); }
1941/*
1942 this is the end of keycode data
1943*/
1944
1945/*
1946 event callback defines start here
1947*/
1948
1949
1950/*
1951 These exist to avoid the
1952 if (func == NULL) check
1953 for (allegedly) better performance
1954
1955 RGFW_EMPTY_DEF exists to prevent the missing-prototypes warning
1956*/
1957#define RGFW_CALLBACK_DEFINE(x, x2) \
1958RGFW_##x##func RGFW_##x##CallbackSrc = NULL; \
1959RGFW_##x##func RGFW_set##x2##Callback(RGFW_##x##func func) { \
1960 RGFW_##x##func prev = RGFW_##x##CallbackSrc; \
1961 RGFW_##x##CallbackSrc = func; \
1962 return prev; \
1963}
1964
1965RGFW_CALLBACK_DEFINE(windowMaximized, WindowMaximized)
1966#define RGFW_windowMaximizedCallback(win, x, y, w, h) if (RGFW_windowMaximizedCallbackSrc) RGFW_windowMaximizedCallbackSrc(win, x, y, w, h);
1967
1968RGFW_CALLBACK_DEFINE(windowMinimized, WindowMinimized)
1969#define RGFW_windowMinimizedCallback(w) if (RGFW_windowMinimizedCallbackSrc) RGFW_windowMinimizedCallbackSrc(w);
1970
1971RGFW_CALLBACK_DEFINE(windowRestored, WindowRestored)
1972#define RGFW_windowRestoredCallback(win, x, y, w, h) if (RGFW_windowRestoredCallbackSrc) RGFW_windowRestoredCallbackSrc(win, x, y, w, h);
1973
1974RGFW_CALLBACK_DEFINE(windowMoved, WindowMoved)
1975#define RGFW_windowMovedCallback(w, x, y) if (RGFW_windowMovedCallbackSrc) RGFW_windowMovedCallbackSrc(w, x, y);
1976
1977RGFW_CALLBACK_DEFINE(windowResized, WindowResized)
1978#define RGFW_windowResizedCallback(win, w, h) if (RGFW_windowResizedCallbackSrc) RGFW_windowResizedCallbackSrc(win, w, h);
1979
1980RGFW_CALLBACK_DEFINE(windowQuit, WindowQuit)
1981#define RGFW_windowQuitCallback(w) if (RGFW_windowQuitCallbackSrc) RGFW_windowQuitCallbackSrc(w);
1982
1983RGFW_CALLBACK_DEFINE(mousePos, MousePos)
1984#define RGFW_mousePosCallback(w, x, y, vecX, vecY) if (RGFW_mousePosCallbackSrc) RGFW_mousePosCallbackSrc(w, x, y, vecX, vecY);
1985
1986RGFW_CALLBACK_DEFINE(windowRefresh, WindowRefresh)
1987#define RGFW_windowRefreshCallback(w) if (RGFW_windowRefreshCallbackSrc) RGFW_windowRefreshCallbackSrc(w);
1988
1989RGFW_CALLBACK_DEFINE(focus, Focus)
1990#define RGFW_focusCallback(w, inFocus) if (RGFW_focusCallbackSrc) RGFW_focusCallbackSrc(w, inFocus);
1991
1992RGFW_CALLBACK_DEFINE(mouseNotify, MouseNotify)
1993#define RGFW_mouseNotifyCallback(w, x, y, status) if (RGFW_mouseNotifyCallbackSrc) RGFW_mouseNotifyCallbackSrc(w, x, y, status);
1994
1995RGFW_CALLBACK_DEFINE(dataDrop, DataDrop)
1996#define RGFW_dataDropCallback(w, files, count) if (RGFW_dataDropCallbackSrc) RGFW_dataDropCallbackSrc(w, files, count);
1997
1998RGFW_CALLBACK_DEFINE(dataDrag, DataDrag)
1999#define RGFW_dataDragCallback(w, x, y) if (RGFW_dataDragCallbackSrc) RGFW_dataDragCallbackSrc(w, x, y);
2000
2001RGFW_CALLBACK_DEFINE(key, Key)
2002#define RGFW_keyCallback(w, key, sym, mod, repeat, press) if (RGFW_keyCallbackSrc) RGFW_keyCallbackSrc(w, key, sym, mod, repeat, press);
2003
2004RGFW_CALLBACK_DEFINE(mouseButton, MouseButton)
2005#define RGFW_mouseButtonCallback(w, button, press) if (RGFW_mouseButtonCallbackSrc) RGFW_mouseButtonCallbackSrc(w, button, press);
2006
2007RGFW_CALLBACK_DEFINE(mouseScroll, MouseScroll)
2008#define RGFW_mouseScrollCallback(w, x, y) if (RGFW_mouseScrollCallbackSrc) RGFW_mouseScrollCallbackSrc(w, x, y);
2009
2010RGFW_CALLBACK_DEFINE(scaleUpdated, ScaleUpdated)
2011#define RGFW_scaleUpdatedCallback(w, scaleX, scaleY) if (RGFW_scaleUpdatedCallbackSrc) RGFW_scaleUpdatedCallbackSrc(w, scaleX, scaleY);
2012
2013RGFW_CALLBACK_DEFINE(debug, Debug)
2014#define RGFW_debugCallback(type, err, msg) if (RGFW_debugCallbackSrc) RGFW_debugCallbackSrc(type, err, msg);
2015#undef RGFW_CALLBACK_DEFINE
2016
2017#ifdef RGFW_DEBUG
2018#include <stdio.h>
2019#endif
2020
2021void RGFW_sendDebugInfo(RGFW_debugType type, RGFW_errorCode err, const char* msg) {
2022 RGFW_debugCallback(type, err, msg);
2023
2024 #ifdef RGFW_DEBUG
2025 switch (type) {
2026 case RGFW_typeInfo: RGFW_PRINTF("RGFW INFO (%i %i): %s", type, err, msg); break;
2027 case RGFW_typeError: RGFW_PRINTF("RGFW DEBUG (%i %i): %s", type, err, msg); break;
2028 case RGFW_typeWarning: RGFW_PRINTF("RGFW WARNING (%i %i): %s", type, err, msg); break;
2029 default: break;
2030 }
2031
2032 RGFW_PRINTF("\n");
2033 #endif
2034}
2035
2036void RGFW_window_checkMode(RGFW_window* win);
2037void RGFW_window_checkMode(RGFW_window* win) {
2038 if (RGFW_window_isMinimized(win) && (win->internal.enabledEvents & RGFW_windowMinimizedFlag)) {
2039 win->internal.flags |= RGFW_windowMinimize;
2040 RGFW_eventQueuePushEx(e.type = RGFW_windowMinimized; e.common.win = win);
2041 RGFW_windowMinimizedCallback(win);
2042 } else if (RGFW_window_isMaximized(win) && (win->internal.enabledEvents & RGFW_windowMaximizedFlag)) {
2043 win->internal.flags |= RGFW_windowMaximize;
2044 RGFW_eventQueuePushEx(e.type = RGFW_windowMaximized; e.common.win = win);
2045 RGFW_windowMaximizedCallback(win, win->x, win->y, win->w, win->h);
2046 } else if ((((win->internal.flags & RGFW_windowMinimize) && !RGFW_window_isMaximized(win)) ||
2047 (win->internal.flags & RGFW_windowMaximize && !RGFW_window_isMaximized(win))) && (win->internal.enabledEvents & RGFW_windowRestoredFlag)) {
2048 win->internal.flags &= ~(u32)RGFW_windowMinimize;
2049 if (RGFW_window_isMaximized(win) == RGFW_FALSE) win->internal.flags &= ~(u32)RGFW_windowMaximize;
2050 RGFW_eventQueuePushEx(e.type = RGFW_windowRestored; e.common.win = win);
2051 RGFW_windowRestoredCallback(win, win->x, win->y, win->w, win->h);
2052 }
2053}
2054
2055/*
2056no more event call back defines
2057*/
2058
2059#define SET_ATTRIB(a, v) { \
2060 RGFW_ASSERT(((size_t) index + 1) < sizeof(attribs) / sizeof(attribs[0])); \
2061 attribs[index++] = a; \
2062 attribs[index++] = v; \
2063}
2064
2065size_t RGFW_sizeofInfo(void) { return sizeof(RGFW_info); }
2066size_t RGFW_sizeofNativeImage(void) { return sizeof(RGFW_nativeImage); }
2067size_t RGFW_sizeofSurface(void) { return sizeof(RGFW_surface); }
2068size_t RGFW_sizeofWindow(void) { return sizeof(RGFW_window); }
2069size_t RGFW_sizeofWindowSrc(void) { return sizeof(RGFW_window_src); }
2070
2071RGFW_window_src* RGFW_window_getSrc(RGFW_window* win) { return &win->src; }
2072RGFW_bool RGFW_window_getPosition(RGFW_window* win, i32* x, i32* y) { if (x) *x = win->x; if (y) *y = win->y; return RGFW_TRUE; }
2073RGFW_bool RGFW_window_getSize(RGFW_window* win, i32* w, i32* h) { if (w) *w = win->w; if (h) *h = win->h; return RGFW_TRUE; }
2074u32 RGFW_window_getFlags(RGFW_window* win) { return win->internal.flags; }
2075RGFW_key RGFW_window_getExitKey(RGFW_window* win) { return win->internal.exitKey; }
2076void RGFW_window_setExitKey(RGFW_window* win, RGFW_key key) { win->internal.exitKey = key; }
2077void RGFW_window_setEnabledEvents(RGFW_window* win, RGFW_eventFlag events) { win->internal.enabledEvents = events; }
2078RGFW_eventFlag RGFW_window_getEnabledEvents(RGFW_window* win) { return win->internal.enabledEvents; }
2079void RGFW_window_setDisabledEvents(RGFW_window* win, RGFW_eventFlag events) { RGFW_window_setEnabledEvents(win, (RGFW_allEventFlags) & ~(u32)events); }
2080void RGFW_window_setEventState(RGFW_window* win, RGFW_eventFlag event, RGFW_bool state) { RGFW_setBit(&win->internal.enabledEvents, event, state); }
2081void* RGFW_window_getUserPtr(RGFW_window* win) { return win->userPtr; }
2082void RGFW_window_setUserPtr(RGFW_window* win, void* ptr) { win->userPtr = ptr; }
2083
2084
2085#if defined(RGFW_USE_XDL) && defined(RGFW_X11)
2086 #define XDL_IMPLEMENTATION
2087 #include "XDL.h"
2088#endif
2089
2090#ifndef RGFW_FORCE_INIT
2091RGFW_info _rgfwGlobal;
2092#endif
2093
2094i32 RGFW_init(void) { return RGFW_init_ptr(&_rgfwGlobal); }
2095void RGFW_deinit(void) { RGFW_deinit_ptr(&_rgfwGlobal); }
2096
2097i32 RGFW_initPlatform(void);
2098void RGFW_deinitPlatform(void);
2099
2100i32 RGFW_init_ptr(RGFW_info* info) {
2101 if (info == _RGFW || info == NULL) return 1;
2102
2103 RGFW_setInfo(info);
2104 RGFW_MEMSET(_RGFW, 0, sizeof(RGFW_info));
2105 _RGFW->queueEvents = RGFW_FALSE;
2106 _RGFW->polledEvents = RGFW_FALSE;
2107#ifdef RGFW_WAYLAND
2108 _RGFW->useWaylandBool = RGFW_TRUE;
2109#endif
2110
2111 _RGFW->files = (char**)(void*)_RGFW->filesSrc;
2112 u32 i;
2113 for (i = 0; i < RGFW_MAX_DROPS; i++)
2114 _RGFW->files[i] = (char*)(_RGFW->filesSrc + RGFW_MAX_DROPS + (i * RGFW_MAX_PATH));
2115
2116 _RGFW->monitors.freeList.head = &_RGFW->monitors.data[0];
2117 _RGFW->monitors.freeList.cur = _RGFW->monitors.freeList.head;
2118
2119 for (i = 1; i < RGFW_MAX_MONITORS; i++) {
2120 RGFW_monitorNode* newNode = &_RGFW->monitors.data[i];
2121 _RGFW->monitors.freeList.cur->next = newNode;
2122 _RGFW->monitors.freeList.cur = _RGFW->monitors.freeList.cur->next;
2123 }
2124
2125 RGFW_initKeycodes();
2126 i32 out = RGFW_initPlatform();
2127 RGFW_sendDebugInfo(RGFW_typeInfo, RGFW_infoGlobal, "global context initialized");
2128
2129 return out;
2130}
2131
2132#ifndef RGFW_EGL
2133void RGFW_unloadEGL(void) { }
2134#endif
2135
2136void RGFW_deinit_ptr(RGFW_info* info) {
2137 if (info == NULL) return;
2138
2139 RGFW_setInfo(info);
2140 RGFW_unloadEGL();
2141 RGFW_deinitPlatform();
2142
2143 _RGFW->root = NULL;
2144 _RGFW->windowCount = 0;
2145 RGFW_setInfo(NULL);
2146 RGFW_sendDebugInfo(RGFW_typeInfo, RGFW_infoGlobal, "global context deinitialized");
2147}
2148
2149RGFW_window* RGFW_createWindow(const char* name, i32 x, i32 y, i32 w, i32 h, RGFW_windowFlags flags) {
2150 RGFW_window* win = (RGFW_window*)RGFW_ALLOC(sizeof(RGFW_window));
2151 RGFW_ASSERT(win != NULL);
2152 return RGFW_createWindowPtr(name, x, y, w, h, flags, win);
2153}
2154
2155void RGFW_window_close(RGFW_window* win) {
2156 RGFW_ASSERT(win != NULL);
2157 RGFW_window_closePtr(win);
2158 RGFW_FREE(win);
2159}
2160
2161RGFW_window* RGFW_createWindowPtr(const char* name, i32 x, i32 y, i32 w, i32 h, RGFW_windowFlags flags, RGFW_window* win) {
2162 RGFW_ASSERT(win != NULL);
2163 RGFW_MEMSET(win, 0, sizeof(RGFW_window));
2164 if (_RGFW == NULL) RGFW_init();
2165 _RGFW->windowCount++;
2166
2167 /* rect based the requested flags */
2168 if (_RGFW->root == NULL) {
2169 RGFW_setRootWindow(win);
2170 }
2171
2172 /* set and init the new window's data */
2173 win->x = x;
2174 win->y = y;
2175 win->w = w;
2176 win->h = h;
2177 win->internal.flags = flags;
2178 win->internal.enabledEvents = RGFW_allEventFlags;
2179
2180 RGFW_window* ret = RGFW_createWindowPlatform(name, flags, win);
2181
2182#ifndef RGFW_X11
2183 RGFW_window_setFlagsInternal(win, flags, 0);
2184#endif
2185
2186#ifdef RGFW_OPENGL
2187 win->src.gfxType = 0;
2188 if (flags & RGFW_windowOpenGL)
2189 RGFW_window_createContext_OpenGL(win, RGFW_getGlobalHints_OpenGL());
2190#endif
2191
2192#ifdef RGFW_EGL
2193 if (flags & RGFW_windowEGL)
2194 RGFW_window_createContext_EGL(win, RGFW_getGlobalHints_OpenGL());
2195#endif
2196
2197 /* X11 creates the window after the OpenGL context is created (because of visual garbage),
2198 * so we have to wait to set the flags
2199 * This is required so that way the user can create their own OpenGL context after RGFW_createWindow is used
2200 * if a window is crated, CreateContext will delete the window and create a new one
2201 * */
2202#ifdef RGFW_X11
2203 RGFW_window_setFlagsInternal(win, flags, 0);
2204#endif
2205
2206#ifdef RGFW_WAYLAND
2207 /* NOTE: this is a hack so that way wayland spawns a window, even if nothing is drawn */
2208 if (RGFW_usingWayland() && !(flags & RGFW_windowOpenGL) && !(flags & RGFW_windowEGL)) {
2209 u8* data = (u8*)RGFW_ALLOC((u32)(win->w * win->h * 3));
2210 RGFW_MEMSET(data, 0, (u32)(win->w * win->h * 3) * sizeof(u8));
2211 RGFW_surface* surface = RGFW_createSurface(data, win->w, win->h, RGFW_formatBGR8);
2212 RGFW_window_blitSurface(win, surface);
2213 RGFW_FREE(data);
2214 RGFW_surface_free(surface);
2215 }
2216#endif
2217
2218#ifdef RGFW_MACOS
2219 /*NOTE: another OpenGL/setFlags related hack, this because OSX the 'view' class must be setup after the NSOpenGL view is made AND after setFlags happens */
2220 RGFW_osx_initView(win);
2221#endif
2222
2223 RGFW_window_setMouseDefault(win);
2224 RGFW_window_setName(win, name);
2225 if (!(flags & RGFW_windowHide)) {
2226 RGFW_window_show(win);
2227 }
2228
2229 RGFW_sendDebugInfo(RGFW_typeInfo, RGFW_infoWindow, "a new window was created");
2230 return ret;
2231}
2232
2233void RGFW_window_closePtr(RGFW_window* win) {
2234 RGFW_ASSERT(win != NULL);
2235
2236 #ifdef RGFW_EGL
2237 if ((win->src.gfxType & RGFW_gfxEGL) && win->src.ctx.egl) {
2238 RGFW_window_deleteContext_EGL(win, win->src.ctx.egl);
2239 win->src.ctx.egl = NULL;
2240 }
2241 #endif
2242
2243 #ifdef RGFW_OPENGL
2244 if ((win->src.gfxType & RGFW_gfxNativeOpenGL) && win->src.ctx.native) {
2245 RGFW_window_deleteContext_OpenGL(win, win->src.ctx.native);
2246 win->src.ctx.native = NULL;
2247 }
2248 #endif
2249
2250 RGFW_window_closePlatform(win);
2251
2252 RGFW_clipboard_switch(NULL);
2253 _RGFW->windowCount--;
2254 if (_RGFW->windowCount == 0) RGFW_deinit();
2255
2256 RGFW_sendDebugInfo(RGFW_typeInfo, RGFW_infoWindow, "a window was freed");
2257}
2258
2259void RGFW_setQueueEvents(RGFW_bool queue) { _RGFW->queueEvents = RGFW_BOOL(queue); }
2260
2261void RGFW_eventQueueFlush(void) { _RGFW->eventLen = 0; }
2262
2263void RGFW_eventQueuePush(const RGFW_event* event) {
2264 if (_RGFW->queueEvents == RGFW_FALSE) return;
2265 RGFW_ASSERT(_RGFW->eventLen >= 0);
2266
2267 if (_RGFW->eventLen >= RGFW_MAX_EVENTS) {
2268 RGFW_sendDebugInfo(RGFW_typeError, RGFW_errEventQueue, "Event queue limit 'RGFW_MAX_EVENTS' has been reached automatically flushing queue.");
2269 RGFW_eventQueueFlush();
2270 return;
2271 }
2272
2273 _RGFW->eventLen += 1;
2274 _RGFW->events[RGFW_MAX_EVENTS - _RGFW->eventLen] = *event;
2275}
2276
2277RGFW_event* RGFW_eventQueuePop(RGFW_window* win) {
2278 RGFW_ASSERT(_RGFW->eventLen >= 0 && _RGFW->eventLen <= RGFW_MAX_EVENTS);
2279 RGFW_event* ev;
2280
2281 if (_RGFW->eventLen == 0) {
2282 return NULL;
2283 }
2284
2285 ev = &_RGFW->events[RGFW_MAX_EVENTS - _RGFW->eventLen];
2286 _RGFW->eventLen -= 1;
2287
2288 if (ev->common.win != win && ev->common.win != NULL) {
2289 RGFW_eventQueuePush(ev);
2290 return NULL;
2291 }
2292
2293 return ev;
2294}
2295
2296void RGFW_resetPrevState(void) {
2297 size_t i;
2298 for (i = 0; i < RGFW_keyLast; i++) _RGFW->keyboard[i].prev = _RGFW->keyboard[i].current;
2299 for (i = 0; i < RGFW_mouseFinal; i++) _RGFW->mouseButtons[i].prev = _RGFW->mouseButtons[i].current;
2300 _RGFW->scrollX = 0.0f;
2301 _RGFW->scrollY = 0.0f;
2302 _RGFW->vectorX = (float)0.0f;
2303 _RGFW->vectorY = (float)0.0f;
2304 RGFW_MEMSET(&_RGFW->windowState, 0, sizeof(_RGFW->windowState));
2305}
2306
2307RGFW_bool RGFW_isKeyPressed(RGFW_key key) {
2308 return _RGFW != NULL && _RGFW->keyboard[key].current && !_RGFW->keyboard[key].prev;
2309}
2310
2311RGFW_bool RGFW_isKeyDown(RGFW_key key) {
2312 return _RGFW != NULL && _RGFW->keyboard[key].current;
2313}
2314
2315RGFW_bool RGFW_isKeyReleased(RGFW_key key) {
2316 return _RGFW != NULL && !_RGFW->keyboard[key].current && _RGFW->keyboard[key].prev;
2317}
2318
2319
2320RGFW_bool RGFW_isMousePressed(RGFW_mouseButton button) {
2321 return _RGFW != NULL && _RGFW->mouseButtons[button].current && !_RGFW->mouseButtons[button].prev;
2322}
2323RGFW_bool RGFW_isMouseDown(RGFW_mouseButton button) {
2324 return _RGFW != NULL && _RGFW->mouseButtons[button].current;
2325}
2326RGFW_bool RGFW_isMouseReleased(RGFW_mouseButton button) {
2327 return _RGFW != NULL && !_RGFW->mouseButtons[button].current && _RGFW->mouseButtons[button].prev;
2328}
2329
2330void RGFW_getMouseScroll(float* x, float* y) {
2331 RGFW_ASSERT(_RGFW != NULL);
2332 if (x) *x = _RGFW->scrollX;
2333 if (y) *y = _RGFW->scrollY;
2334}
2335
2336void RGFW_getMouseVector(float* x, float* y) {
2337 RGFW_ASSERT(_RGFW != NULL);
2338 if (x) *x = _RGFW->vectorX;
2339 if (y) *y = _RGFW->vectorY;
2340}
2341
2342RGFW_bool RGFW_window_didMouseLeave(RGFW_window* win) { return _RGFW->windowState.winLeave == win && _RGFW->windowState.mouseLeave; }
2343RGFW_bool RGFW_window_didMouseEnter(RGFW_window* win) { return _RGFW->windowState.win == win && _RGFW->windowState.mouseEnter; }
2344RGFW_bool RGFW_window_isMouseInside(RGFW_window* win) { return win->internal.mouseInside; }
2345
2346RGFW_bool RGFW_window_isDataDragging(RGFW_window* win) { return RGFW_window_getDataDrag(win, (i32*)NULL, (i32*)NULL); }
2347RGFW_bool RGFW_window_didDataDrop(RGFW_window* win) { return RGFW_window_getDataDrop(win, (const char***)NULL, (size_t*)NULL);}
2348
2349
2350RGFW_bool RGFW_window_getDataDrag(RGFW_window* win, i32* x, i32* y) {
2351 if (_RGFW->windowState.win != win || _RGFW->windowState.dataDragging == RGFW_FALSE) return RGFW_FALSE;
2352 if (x) *x = _RGFW->windowState.dropX;
2353 if (y) *y = _RGFW->windowState.dropY;
2354 return RGFW_TRUE;
2355}
2356RGFW_bool RGFW_window_getDataDrop(RGFW_window* win, const char*** files, size_t* count) {
2357 if (_RGFW->windowState.win != win || _RGFW->windowState.dataDrop == RGFW_FALSE) return RGFW_FALSE;
2358 if (files) *files = (const char**)_RGFW->files;
2359 if (count) *count = _RGFW->windowState.filesCount;
2360 return RGFW_TRUE;
2361}
2362
2363RGFW_bool RGFW_window_checkEvent(RGFW_window* win, RGFW_event* event) {
2364 if (_RGFW->eventLen == 0 && _RGFW->polledEvents == RGFW_FALSE) {
2365 _RGFW->queueEvents = RGFW_TRUE;
2366 RGFW_pollEvents();
2367 _RGFW->polledEvents = RGFW_TRUE;
2368 }
2369
2370 if (RGFW_window_checkQueuedEvent(win, event) == RGFW_FALSE) {
2371 _RGFW->polledEvents = RGFW_FALSE;
2372 return RGFW_FALSE;
2373 }
2374
2375 return RGFW_TRUE;
2376}
2377
2378RGFW_bool RGFW_window_checkQueuedEvent(RGFW_window* win, RGFW_event* event) {
2379 RGFW_event* ev;
2380 RGFW_ASSERT(win != NULL);
2381 _RGFW->queueEvents = RGFW_TRUE;
2382 /* check queued events */
2383 ev = RGFW_eventQueuePop(win);
2384 if (ev != NULL) {
2385 if (ev->type == RGFW_quit) RGFW_window_setShouldClose(win, RGFW_TRUE);
2386 *event = *ev;
2387 return RGFW_TRUE;
2388 }
2389
2390 return RGFW_FALSE;
2391}
2392
2393void RGFW_setRootWindow(RGFW_window* win) { _RGFW->root = win; }
2394RGFW_window* RGFW_getRootWindow(void) { return _RGFW->root; }
2395
2396#ifndef RGFW_EGL
2397RGFW_bool RGFW_loadEGL(void) { return RGFW_FALSE; }
2398#endif
2399
2400void RGFW_window_setFlagsInternal(RGFW_window* win, RGFW_windowFlags flags, RGFW_windowFlags cmpFlags) {
2401 #ifndef RGFW_NO_MONITOR
2402 if (flags & RGFW_windowScaleToMonitor) RGFW_window_scaleToMonitor(win);
2403 #endif
2404
2405 if (flags & RGFW_windowCenter) RGFW_window_center(win);
2406 if (flags & RGFW_windowCenterCursor) RGFW_window_moveMouse(win, win->x + (win->w / 2), win->y + (win->h / 2));
2407 if (flags & RGFW_windowNoBorder) RGFW_window_setBorder(win, 0);
2408 else if (cmpFlags & RGFW_windowNoBorder) RGFW_window_setBorder(win, 1);
2409 if (flags & RGFW_windowFullscreen) RGFW_window_setFullscreen(win, RGFW_TRUE);
2410 else if (cmpFlags & RGFW_windowFullscreen) RGFW_window_setFullscreen(win, 0);
2411 if (flags & RGFW_windowMaximize) RGFW_window_maximize(win);
2412 else if (cmpFlags & RGFW_windowMaximize) RGFW_window_restore(win);
2413 if (flags & RGFW_windowMinimize) RGFW_window_minimize(win);
2414 else if (cmpFlags & RGFW_windowMinimize) RGFW_window_restore(win);
2415 if (flags & RGFW_windowHideMouse) RGFW_window_showMouse(win, 0);
2416 else if (cmpFlags & RGFW_windowHideMouse) RGFW_window_showMouse(win, 1);
2417 if (flags & RGFW_windowHide) RGFW_window_hide(win);
2418 else if (cmpFlags & RGFW_windowHide) RGFW_window_show(win);
2419 if (flags & RGFW_windowFloating) RGFW_window_setFloating(win, 1);
2420 else if (cmpFlags & RGFW_windowFloating) RGFW_window_setFloating(win, 0);
2421 if (flags & RGFW_windowFocus) RGFW_window_focus(win);
2422
2423 if (flags & RGFW_windowNoResize) {
2424 RGFW_window_setMaxSize(win, win->w, win->h);
2425 RGFW_window_setMinSize(win, win->w, win->h);
2426 } else if (cmpFlags & RGFW_windowNoResize) {
2427 RGFW_window_setMaxSize(win, 0, 0);
2428 RGFW_window_setMinSize(win, 0, 0);
2429 }
2430
2431 win->internal.flags = flags;
2432}
2433
2434
2435void RGFW_window_setFlags(RGFW_window* win, RGFW_windowFlags flags) { RGFW_window_setFlagsInternal(win, flags, win->internal.flags); }
2436
2437RGFW_bool RGFW_window_isInFocus(RGFW_window* win) {
2438#ifdef RGFW_WASM
2439 return RGFW_TRUE;
2440#else
2441 return RGFW_BOOL(win->internal.inFocus);
2442#endif
2443}
2444
2445void RGFW_setClassName(const char* name) { RGFW_init(); _RGFW->className = name; }
2446
2447#ifndef RGFW_X11
2448void RGFW_setXInstName(const char* name) { RGFW_UNUSED(name); }
2449#endif
2450
2451RGFW_bool RGFW_window_getMouse(RGFW_window* win, i32* x, i32* y) {
2452 RGFW_ASSERT(win != NULL);
2453 if (x) *x = win->internal.lastMouseX;
2454 if (y) *y = win->internal.lastMouseY;
2455 return RGFW_TRUE;
2456}
2457
2458RGFW_bool RGFW_window_isKeyPressed(RGFW_window* win, RGFW_key key) { return RGFW_isKeyPressed(key) && RGFW_window_isInFocus(win); }
2459RGFW_bool RGFW_window_isKeyDown(RGFW_window* win, RGFW_key key) { return RGFW_isKeyDown(key) && RGFW_window_isInFocus(win); }
2460RGFW_bool RGFW_window_isKeyReleased(RGFW_window* win, RGFW_key key) { return RGFW_isKeyReleased(key) && RGFW_window_isInFocus(win); }
2461
2462RGFW_bool RGFW_window_isMousePressed(RGFW_window* win, RGFW_mouseButton button) { return RGFW_isMousePressed(button) && RGFW_window_isInFocus(win); }
2463RGFW_bool RGFW_window_isMouseDown(RGFW_window* win, RGFW_mouseButton button) { return RGFW_isMouseDown(button) && RGFW_window_isInFocus(win); }
2464RGFW_bool RGFW_window_isMouseReleased(RGFW_window* win, RGFW_mouseButton button) { return RGFW_isMouseReleased(button) && RGFW_window_isInFocus(win); }
2465
2466
2467
2468#ifndef RGFW_X11
2469void* RGFW_getDisplay_X11(void) { return NULL; }
2470u64 RGFW_window_getWindow_X11(RGFW_window* win) { RGFW_UNUSED(win); return 0; }
2471#endif
2472
2473#ifndef RGFW_WAYLAND
2474struct wl_display* RGFW_getDisplay_Wayland(void) { return NULL; }
2475struct wl_surface* RGFW_window_getWindow_Wayland(RGFW_window* win) { RGFW_UNUSED(win); return NULL; }
2476#endif
